metadata.Title: CVE-2017-15650 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - medium
metadata.Description:
musl libc before 1.1.17 has a buffer overflow via crafted DNS repliesbecause dns_parse_callback in network/lookup_name.c does not restrict thenumber of addresses, and thus an attacker can provide an unexpected numberby sending A records in a reply to an AAAA query.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-15650` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

musl - 1.1.19-1
musl-tools - 1.1.19-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: musl package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.1.19-1').
